simplesect.para: These functions are private, so that they can be accessed only through a Node*.

briefdescription.para: Configure persistent internal data structures.

detaileddescription.para: Let node configure persistent internal data structures, such as input buffers or ODE solvers, to runtime information prior to first simulation.

briefdescription.para: Re-calculate dependent parameters of the node.

detaileddescription.para: This function is called each time a simulation is begun/resumed. It must re-calculate all internal Variables of the node required for spike handling or updating the node.

memberdef.argsstring: (Time const &, const long, const long) override
memberdef.name: update

briefdescription.para: Bring the node from state $t$ to $t+n*dt$.

detaileddescription.para: n->update(T, from, to) performs the update steps beginning at T+from .. T+to-1, ie, emitting events with time stamps T+from+1 .. T+to.

parameterdescription.para: network time at beginning of time slice.

memberdef.argsstring: (Time const &origin, const long lag, const double offset_U)
memberdef.name: emit_spike_

briefdescription.para: Calculate the precise spike time, emit the spike and reset the neuron.

parameterdescription.para: Time stamp at beginning of slice
Time offset for U value, i.e. for time when threshold crossing was detected

memberdef.argsstring: (Time const &origin, const long lag, const double spike_offset)
memberdef.name: emit_instant_spike_

briefdescription.para: Instantaneously emit a spike at the precise time defined by origin, lag and spike_offset and reset the neuron.

parameterdescription.para: Time stamp at beginning of slice

briefdescription.para: Propagate neuron state.

detaileddescription.para:
Propagate the neuron's state by dt.
dt
Interval over which to propagate

briefdescription.para: Read out the real membrane potential.
Mapping of recordables names to access functions.
Basic constructor.

detaileddescription.para: This constructor should only be used by GenericModel to create model prototype instances.

briefdescription.para: Copy constructor.

detaileddescription.para: GenericModel::create_() uses the copy constructor to clone actual model instances from the prototype instance.

simplesect.para: The copy constructor MUST NOT be used to create nodes based on nodes that have been placed in the network.

briefdescription.para: Send an event to the receiving_node passed as an argument.

detaileddescription.para: Default implementation of check_connection just throws IllegalConnection.
This is required during the connection handshaking to test, if the receiving_node can handle the event type and receptor_type sent by the source node.

If dummy_target is true, this indicates that receiving_node is derived from ConnTestDummyNodeBase and used in the first call to send_test_event(). This can be ignored in most cases, but Nodes sending DS*Events to their own event hooks and then *Events to their proper targets must send DS*Events when called with the dummy target, and *Events when called with the real target, see #478.

briefdescription.para: Check if the node can handle a particular event and receptor type.

detaileddescription.para: This function is called upon connection setup by send_test_event().

handles_test_event() function is used to verify that the receiver can handle the event. It can also be used by the receiver to return information to the sender in form of the returned port. The default implementation throws an IllegalConnection exception. Any node class should define handles_test_event() functions for all those event types it can handle.
See Kunkel et al, Front Neuroinform 8:78 (2014), Sec 3.

simplesect.para: The semantics of all other handles_test_event() functions is identical.

briefdescription.para: Handle incoming spike events.

detaileddescription.para: Default implementation of event handlers just throws an UnexpectedEvent exception.

thrd
Id of the calling thread.
e
Event object.
This handler has to be implemented if a Node should accept spike events.
class SpikeEvent
class UnexpectedEvent
UnexpectedEvent
This is the default event to throw.

briefdescription.para: Handler for current events.
Handler for universal data logging request.
Returns true if the node sends/receives off-grid events.

detaileddescription.para: This is used to discriminate between different types of nodes when adding new nodes to the network.

briefdescription.para: Export properties of the node by setting entries in the status dictionary.
Change properties of the node according to the entries in the dictionary.

handles_test_event() function is used to verify that the receiver can handle the event. It can also be used by the receiver to return information to the sender in form of the returned port.
